findings.label: Suppliers with Current Red Flags
findings.detail: 8 current suppliers have Companies House compliance issues (historical payments were made before breaches started)

findings.label: Likely Duplicate Payments
findings.detail: 29 high-confidence duplicate groups with same supplier, amount, date and reference (3+ copies) (after filtering 2675 CSV republication artifacts)
findings.context_note: Quarterly CSV overlaps (same transaction appearing in 2 files) have been filtered out. Remaining duplicates show 3+ identical copies, which are more likely genuine overpayments.

findings.label: Suspected Split Payments
findings.detail: 10 instances of 3+ payments just below approval thresholds in the same week
findings.context_note: Split payment detection has a high false-positive rate. Batch processing, staged invoices, and legitimate recurring payments can all trigger this pattern. FOI request for procurement approval chain recommended before drawing conclusions.

findings.label: Round-Number Payments (>£5K)
findings.detail: 300 exact round-number payments over £5,000 — may indicate estimates rather than invoiced amounts

findings.label: Year-End Spending Pattern
findings.detail: ENVIRONMENT AND PLACE spent 3.4x their monthly average in March (£2.2M above normal). Note: UK councils operate on April–March fiscal years, so elevated March spending is common as departments finalise annual budgets. Spikes above 3x warrant further scrutiny.
findings.context_note: March spending above the monthly average is expected for UK councils on April–March fiscal years. Compare against prior years' March figures for meaningful analysis.

findings.label: Rapid Payment Suppliers
findings.detail: 15 suppliers receive payments every <14 days on average. Top: 1 Ace Skips Ltd (5.3 day avg, 755 payments, £573.7K)

findings.label: Benford's Law Anomaly
findings.detail: Significant deviation from Benford's Law (p < 0.001). Digit 5 deviates 9.7% from expected distribution across 26,975 transactions. Note: with 26,975 transactions, chi-squared tests are highly sensitive — the 9.7% max digit deviation is the more practical measure of anomaly.
findings.context_note: Chi-squared values on samples of 26,975+ transactions are naturally inflated and will almost always show statistical significance. The max digit deviation (9.7%) is a more meaningful indicator — deviations under 5% are typical for legitimate council spending.

key_findings.title: 3 suppliers with clock-like payment regularity
key_findings.description: These suppliers receive payments at near-identical intervals (std dev <5 days). Top: Whitewells Catering Supplies — every 6.3 days (214 payments, £417.9K)

key_findings.title: NPOWER COMMERCIAL GAS LTD: 1376 transactions totalling £4.9M
key_findings.description: Averaging £3.6K per transaction — the council's most frequent supplier

key_findings.title: 22 suppliers shared with neighbouring councils — £19.4M total
key_findings.description: Compare what each council pays the same suppliers for similar services

key_findings.title: WATER PLUS LTD: 9171% price gap between councils
key_findings.description: Lancaster pays £28.0K avg vs Pendle £302 (both with 3+ transactions). Price differences may reflect different service scope, contract terms, or volumes rather than overcharging — manual review recommended.
key_findings.context_note: Cross-council price comparisons use common financial years only (where both councils have data for the same supplier). This prevents unfair comparisons between councils with different data periods. Differences may still reflect different service levels or contract terms.

rapid_payers.supplier: FIPL GRANT PAID TO AN INDIVIDUAL
